intro: Hieracium adconfluens, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Hieracium adconfluens is often found in open habitats and is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
